ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription:
Demonstrates mouse-wheel zooming and scrolling of SciChart.
Overlays a candlestick and line chart series on a SciChartSurface and applies the MouseWheelZoomModifier. This is a built-in ChartModifierBase derived class which adds the behavior of scrolling and zooming on mouse-wheel.
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates the many modes of operation of the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#MouseWheelZoomModifier.html']MouseWheelZoomModifier[/url]. The default mode is Zoom around a point in the X and Y directions. ChartModifiers can be added to the SciChartSurface via the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.SciChartSurface~ChartModifier.html']SciChartSurface.ChartModifier[/url] property, or via a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.ModifierGroup.html']ModifierGroup[/url]
Additional modes are the ability to zoom in one direction only, or pan via the mouse-wheel. Try pressing CTRL or SHIFT while mouse-wheel scrolling to see the effect.
Finally, double-click to reset zoom at any time. This functionality is provided by the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#ZoomExtentsModifier.html']ZoomExtentsModifier[/url]
